newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila stocks end lower despite late rebound.
newsitem.headline: Manila stocks end lower despite late rebound.

text.p: Manila stocks bounced back at the close on Friday, but not enough to pull up the market from negative territory, traders said.
The main index ended 26.45 points lower at 3,234.79 but off the day's low of 3,202.78.
"The banking sector helped the market recover in late trade on report Victorias agreed to reprice interest on its loans," said Monique Lecaros, trader at Sun Hung Kai Securities.

The sugar miller got a 90-day reprieve on principal payments on its 4.423 billion pesos debt but said it will continue to pay interest to its 32 creditors. Victorias shares shed 20 centavos to 4.90 pesos.
Traders said the market started weak, with the index plunging by 58.46 points by midtrade, on fears of a U.S. rate hike. The Dow Jones fell 160 points overnight while PLDT's ADRs dropped by $1 3/8.
"The Dow's fall and Equitable's IPO which opened on March 5 sidelined investors," Lecaros said. Traders said the local market will take cue from developments in the U.S. next week.
